bibl.title: Ng Key Tung vs. Henry M. White. Criminal.
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: Western District Court of the United States, Northern Division.

div1.p: UNITED STATES DISTRICT COURT WESTERN DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON NORTHERN DIVISION. 2897
IN THE MATTER OF THE APPLICATION OF NG KEY TUNG, FOR A WRIT OF HABEAS CORPUS ) No. PETITION.
Comes now Ng Key Tung, by his father Get Tock, and petitions the Honorable Court for a writ of Habeas Corpus, and alleges the facts to be as follows:
(1) Ng Key Tung is imprisoned and restrained of his liberty by the United States Commissioner of Immigration Henry M. White in the detention Station at Seattle, Washington.

(2) That said imprisonment and restraint is illegal, being contrary to law, and the treaties between United States adn China; that the said Ng Key Tung arrived in Seattle on or about the 15th day of July, 1914, from China; that he was denied admission on or about the 18th day of September, 1914; than an appeal was taken to the Secretary of Labor, and on or about the 4th day of November the decision of the Commissioner in Seattle was affirmed; that applicant will be deported to China unless the said Commissioner is restrained from doing so.

(3) That the interpretation of the testimony in this case was made by a Government interpretor and was erroneous and contrary to the true interpretation, which fact was known or should have been known to the said officials; that there is no question about the applicant Ng Key Tung being the son of Get Tock, and that Get Tock is a merchant and entitled to have his said son landed, but by reason of said interpretation said Commissioner is depriving him of his rights contrary to law.
(4) That the said Ng Key Tung has been denied a fair hearing as provided by law and by the treaties betweeen teh United States and China.
(5) That applicant is able and willing to pay all expenses incurred herein.
div1.ab:
W. T. Laube
Daniel Landon
Attorneys for Petitioner.
div1.p: State of Washington County of King } ss.

Get Tock being first duly sworn on oath says: That he is the Father of Ng Key Jung
in the above entitled action; that he has read the foregoing Petition knows the contents thereof and believes the same to be true:
Subscribed and sworn to before me this 17 day of Nov 1914
div1.ab:
Daniel Landon
Notary Public for the State of Washington, residing at Seattle
div1.p: IN THE District Court Of the United States For the Northern District of Washington Western Division
In the Matter of the application of Ng Key Tung Plaintiff vs. for a writ of Habeas Corpus Defendant
FILED IN THE U. S. District Court, Western Dist. of Washington, NORTHERN DIVISION NOV171914
div1.ab: FRANK L. CROSBY, Clerk, By EML Deputy
div1.p: SERVICE OF PAPERS IN THIS CASE MAY BE MADE ON DANIEL LANDON Attorney for Proctor for { Petitioner
1054-5-6 EMPIRE BLDG., SEATTLE, KING COUNTY, WASHINGTON PHONE MAIN 4602
